org.fluidity.features

Interface Updates


  • public interface Updates
    Periodic update facility. Components wishing to periodically update some data should call snapshot(long, Supplier) upon initialization and then use Supplier.get() on the returned snapshot every time they wish to access the periodically updated data.

    NOTE: This component is designed not to keep a hard reference to any object that registers for updates and thus is a preferred way to the Scheduler component of implementing periodic updates.

    The granularity of the updates can be configured by implementing a PropertyProvider component that returns a valid number for the UPDATE_GRANULARITY key. The default period granularity is 1 second.

    See Configuration for details on configuration.

    Usage

     @Component
 public final class MyComponent {

   private static final long period = TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS.convert(1, TimeUnit.SECONDS);

   private final Updates.Snapshot<Data> data;

   MyComponent(final Updates updates) {
     data = updates.snapshot(period, () -> {
       …
       return new Data(…);    // create or update the data
     });
   }

   public int someMethod() {
     final Data snapshot = data.get();
     …
     return snapshot.…; // access the data snapshot
   }

   …

   private static class Data {
     …
   }
 }

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String UPDATE_GRANULARITY
      The configuration property that specifies the update granularity in milliseconds.

    • Method Summary

      Creates a periodically updated on-demand snapshot for some data.

    • Field Detail

        static final String UPDATE_GRANULARITY

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • snapshot

        <T> Supplier<T> snapshot(long period,
                         Supplier<T> loader)
        Creates a periodically updated on-demand snapshot for some data. The the data is loaded by the given loader, which will be invoked no more frequently than every period milliseconds.

        The actual data update is implemented by the supplied loader, which will be invoked at most once every period milliseconds. The data will be loaded once before this method returns and after that only when the Supplier.get() method is invoked on the returned value.

        The update granularity configured for this component will pose as the lower bound to any positive period specified to this method.If the period specified is 0, the snapshot will be taken once and then cached forever. If the period is negative, no snapshot will be cached and the loader will be invoked at every invocation of Supplier.get().

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of data the given loader provides.
        Parameters:
        period - the number of milliseconds that must pass between subsequent calls to Supplier.get() on the provided loader.
        loader - the object that can refresh the data.
        Returns:
        an object through which the up-to-date data can be obtained.
